'Saya Kesulitan Bernafas': Sriyono Positif Kanker Akibat Bahan Bangunan Asbes
07 Nov 2019, 02:37 by ABC
Australia sudah lama melarang penggunaan bahan bangunan asbes yang telah terbukti mematikan. Tapi di Indonesia, hal itu masih terus berlangsung dalam skala besar seakan tidak menyadari bahaya yang bisa ditimbulkannya.
Organisasi Kesehatan Dunia (WHO) sebenarnya telah memperingatkan epidemi penyakit-penyakit terkait asbes di negara-negara Asia Tenggara termasuk Indonesia.
Tapi sejalan dengan semakin banyaknya negara yang melarang asbes, kelompok lobi industri ini justru semakin meningkatkan promosi penggunaan asbes di Indonesia dan Asia Tenggara.
Kelompok lobi bernama Chrysotile Information Centre (CIC) dan berbasis di Bangkok itu mengklaim bahwa chrysotile - umumnya dikenal sebagai asbes putih - larut di paru-paru setelah 14 hari. Menurut mereka, hal itu tak berbahaya.
Penggunaan asbes di Indonesia terbilang sangat masif. Diperkirakan sekitar 10 persen rumah menggunkan asbes putih untuk atap.
Padahal, asbes putih ini merupakan karsinogen yang dapat menyebabkan berbagai kanker termasuk mesothelioma dan penyakit lainnya.
Apalagi, Indonesia rawan gempa dan bencana sehingga bangunan dan rumah yang menggunakan asbes dapat dengan mudah menjadi puing-puing.


Indonesia sangat rawan gempa sehingga bangunan dan rumah yang menggunakan asbes dapat dengan mudah menjadi puing-puing. Reuters: Jorge Silva

Indonesia umumnya memperlakukan asbes ini seperti tembakau: dapat menyebabkan kanker tetapi tidak dilarang.
Bedanya, orang merokok adalah pilihan pribadi. Tapi ribuan orang termasuk pekerja di 27 pabrik asbes di Indonesia, tidak menyadari bahaya bahan bangunan ini.
Salah satu korban asbes bernama Sriyono, 46 tahun, kini menjadi gambaran dari ledakan korban asbes.
Dedikasinya bekerja selama 25 tahun di pabrik itu, bukannya menghasilkan kesejehteraan bagi dia, istri dan tiga anaknya.
Sriyono kini malah menderita kanker paru-paru stadium akhir. Dia tak bisa lagi bekerja karena penyakitnya itu.
Penyakit kankernya telah menggerogoti berat badan dan kekuatan tubuhnya. Beratnya kini hanya 37 kilogram, kurus, tinggal tulang-belulang.


Kondisi Sriyono sebelum dan sesudah menderita kanker akibat asbes. Supplied

"Dadaku terasa sangat sesak. Saya tak bisa bernapas dengan baik. Ketika saya mencoba melakukan sesuatu, saya gampang lelah," katanya.
Sriyono adalah satu-satunya orang Indonesia yang menerima kompensasi untuk penyakit yang berhubungan dengan asbes.
Tetapi baginya, gantirugi sekitar Rp 70 juta rupiah itu bukannya menghibur. "Saya begitu sangat marah," ujarnya kepada ABC.
"Sampai berhenti kerja, perusahaan tidak peduli. Mereka tak menunjukkan belas kasihan, tidak ada perhatian. Tak ada peralatan keselamatan kerja. Tidak memenuhi standar," tambah Sriyono.
Bahaya mengintai
Tak jauh dari tempat tinggal Sriyono di pinggiran Jakarta, tampak betapa penggunaan asbes begitu massifnya.
Di setiap jalan, tampak rumah-rumah dengan atap berbahan asbes putih.
Di pekarangan salah satu rumah, potongan asbes itu bahkan tergeletak di dekat sumur. Ada anak-anak bermain di situ.
Di rumah lain yang atapnya rendah, tampak warga menjemur pakaian di atap asbes tersebut. Di sana-sini serpihan asbes dibiarkan berserakan begitu saja di tanah.
Situasi ini tak mengherankan. Pasalnya, Indonesia adalah importir asbes terbesar kedua di dunia setelah India.
Menurut data, sekitar 115.000 ton chrysotile digunakan setiap tahun, kebanyakan untuk memproduksi atap karena tahan api dan kuat.


Diperkirakan secara nasional sekitar 10 persen rumah di Indonesia menggunakan atap berbahan asbes penyebab kanker. Tapi di Jakarta angkanya sekitar 54 persen. ABC News

Sejauh ini, hambatan terbesar untuk pelarangan asbes di Indonesia adalah kuatnya lobi industri ini. Mereka aktif mendorong untuk memperluas pasarnya di sini.
Lebih dari 75 persen dari total penggunaan asbes di dunia sekarang di berada Asia.
CIC yang berbasis di Bangkok, sebenarnya mewakili produsen asbes di dua negara pengekspor, Rusia dan Kazakhstan.
Selain bertekad melawan segala upaya untuk melarang chrysotile di Indonesia dan Asia, CIC juga aktif mempromosikan asbes putih sebagai "produk yang aman".
CIC berdalih, proses pembuatan adalah satu-satunya risiko potensial. Risiko ini, katanya, dapat "dikendalikan" melalui teknologi yang tepat.
Dalam video di YouTube, CIC mengklaim chrysotile itu tidak seperti asbes coklat dan biru. Asbes putih, katanya, "larut" di paru-paru dalam tempo dua minggu.
"Jika masuk ke dalam tubuh, ia akan larut dengan sendirinya dalam waktu dua minggu. Itu tidak akan membahayakan kesehatan manusia," demikian klaim CIC.
Mereka menyatakan asbes putih sebagai "serat komersial paling aman."


Asbes putih banyak ditambang di beberapa negara termasuk Russia dan Kazakhstan. Reuters: Ueslei Marcelino

"Penggunaan asbes chrysotile yang terkontrol dan produk-produknya aman bagi pekerja dan konsumen. Mereka yang menentang chrysotile tidak memiliki argumen meyakinkan untuk mendukung pelarangan mineral ini," kata CIC.
Namun penelitian medis telah lama membuktikan bahwa chrysotile dapat menyebabkan penyakit yang berhubungan dengan paparan asbes.
ABC News menghubungi pihak CIC untuk memberikan komentar, tapi belum mendapatkan tanggapan.
Ledakan penyakit
Berbagai penelitian internasional menunjukkan bahwa dalam setiap 20 ton asbes yang digunakan, ada satu orang yang akan mati.
Dengan tolok ukur seperti, diperkirakan hampir 6.000 orang Indonesia setahun kini berpotensi mengidap kanker yang berhubungan dengan asbes.
Tapi informasi dan pendidikan publik mengenai hal ini masih sangat minim.


Pekerja pabrik asbes di Indonesia merupakan kelompok warga yang paling berisiko terpapar kanker. ABC News

Kini, sejumlah LSM lokal bekerja sama dengan LSM dari negara lain giat berkampanye mengenai bahaya asbes bagi kesehatan.
LSM dari Australia ACTU dan APHEDA-Union Aid Abroad, ikut terlibat dalam kegiatan ini.
Mereka melobi Pemerintah RI untuk melarang impor dan penggunaan asbes.
"Indonesia berpotensi besar mengalami ledakan jumlah orang yang terpapar asbes atau penyakit terkait asbes," ujar Muhammad Darisman dari Indonesia Ban Asbestos Network.
"Sembilan puluh persen daerahnya rawan bencana. Asbes adalah zat berbahaya ketika hancur jadi puing-puing," jelasnya.
Pemerintah RI menyatakan telah mengetahui potensi bahaya dari asbes tapi hal ini adalah urusan industri sendiri yang perlu diyakinkan untuk berhenti menggunakannya.


Pemerintah RI menyatakan terserah industri saja apakah mereka mau berhenti menggunakan asbes atau tidak. ABC News

Salah satu tantangan beasr di Indonesia adalah kurangnya alat diagnostik untuk menentukan seberapa banyak orang yang menderita penyakit akibat terpapar asbes.
Saat ini, asbestosis dan penebalan lapisan paru-paru bisa diketahui melalui CT scan.
Tapi sebagian besar kanker yang disebabkan oleh asbes hanya dapat diketahui dengan bukti nyata dari paparan asbes di jaringan paru-paru. Atau bisa juga melalui riwayat kerja seseorang.
"Kami tidak punya peralatan untuk membuat diagnosis dan dokter di sini tak dilatih untuk mendiagnosis mesothelioma," jelas Dokter Anna Suraya dari Perhimpunan Spesialis Kedokteran Okupasi Indonesia (Perdoki).
Sejauh ini baru enam orang Indonesia, termasuk Sriyono, yang dipastikan memiliki penyakit kanker yang terkait dengan asbes.
Upaya melarang asbes
Saat ini 66 negara termasuk Australia telah melarang penggunaan semua bentuk asbes.
Kanada, yang pernah menjadi eksportir utama bahan bangunan ini, juga telah melarang tahun lalu. Bahkan Vietnam dan Laos pun kini berupaya untuk melarang asbes.


Brasil yang pernah menjadi negara pengekspor utama asbes telah meninggalkan industri ini sejak tahun 2017. Reuters: Ueslei Marcelino

Serikat-sekitar buruh di berbagai negara terus berupaya memasukkan asbes putih dalam daftar Konvensi Rotterdam PBB, yang mengatur ekspor-impor bahan kimia berbahaya dan pestisida.
Hal itu akan memaksa Rusia dan negara eksportir lainnya untuk memperingatkan bahaya asbes kepada negara importir seperti Indonesia jika mereka membeli produk ini.
Panel ilmiah Konvensi Rotterdam sendiri merekomendasikan agar asbes putih dimasukkan dalam rdaftar karena sifat karsinogeniknya.
Tapi Rusia dan sekutunya termasuk Kazakhstan, India, Suriah dan Kuba, menggunakan veto untuk memblokir mosi tersebut sejak Konvensi Rotterdam berlaku pada 2004.
Kelompok lobi CIC sendiri berdalih bahwa asbes putih ini aman, karena tidak terdaftar dalam Kovensi Rotterdam.
Menurut Phillip Hazelton dari APHEDA-Union Aid Abroad, CIC sengaja memanipulasi informasi tersebut.
"Konvensi Rotterdam dibajak sebagai alat promosi chrysotile-asbes," katanya. "Menjadikan zat yang sangat berbahaya ini tampak aman."
Semakin memburuk


Mengisap serat asbes bisa menyebabkan kanker dan penyakit di berbagai organ manusia. ABC News: Ario Rasouli

Asbes berbahaya bagi manusia justru karena digunakan dalam konstruksi bangunan: seratnya tidak terbakar atau terpecah.
Serat ini bisa tersangkut di paru-paru manusia, dan menyebar ke organ lainnya.
Kebijakan WHO tentang asbes sangat tegas: "Semua bentuk asbes, termasuk chrysotile, bersifat karsinogenik bagi manusia, menyebabkan mesothelioma dan kanker paru-paru, laring dan ovarium."
Penelitian terbaru dari Global Burden of Disease menunjukkan bahwa asbes menyebabkan kematian lebih dari 220.000 orang di dunia setiap tahun.
"Bahkan di negara yang ketat aturannya, bahan bangunan yang mengandung chrysotil melepaskan serat asbes saat dilakukan pemeliharaan gedung, pembongkaran, dan akibat bencana alam," kata WHO.


"Saya mengalami kanker yang semakin lama hanya akan memburuk," kata Sriyono. ABC News: Phil Hemingway

Sementara itu Sriyono mengaku, dia tidak tahu sampai kapan bisa bertahan akibat penyakit kankernya.
Tapi dia tahu pasti penyakit ini akan menyebabkan kematiannya.
Bertolak belakang dengan klaim CIC, paru-paru Sriyono tidak bisa lagi melarutkan serat chrysotile di tubuhnya.
"Dokter menyampaikan bahwa saya memiliki jenis kanker yang semakin memburuk dari waktu ke waktu," kata Sriyono.
"Tahun lalu saya melakukan pemeriksaan kesehatan dan hasil CT scan menunjukkan ada peningkatan aktivitas di paru-paruku," ujarnya.
Diperkirakan puluhan ribu orang Indonesia akan terserang penyakit yang berhubungan dengan asbes.
Tapi berbeda dengan Sriyono, mungkin kebanyakan di antaranya tak pernah tahu penyakit mereka itu disebabkan oleh asbes.
Simak berita ini dalam Bahasa Inggris di sini.

'I am Difficult to Breathe': Positive Sriyono Cancer Due to Asbestos Building Materials
Nov 7, 2019, 02:37 by ABC
Australia has long banned the use of asbestos building materials that have proven deadly. But in Indonesia, it still continues on a large scale as if unaware of the danger that it can cause.
The World Health Organization (WHO) has actually warned of an epidemic of asbestos-related diseases in Southeast Asian countries including Indonesia.
But in line with the increasing number of countries banning asbestos, this industry lobbying group has even increased promotion of the use of asbestos in Indonesia and Southeast Asia.
The lobby group called Chrysotile Information Center (CIC) and based in Bangkok claims that chrysotile - commonly known as white asbestos - dissolves in the lungs after 14 days. According to them, it was not dangerous.
The use of asbestos in Indonesia is fairly massive. It is estimated that about 10 percent of homes use white asbestos for roofing.
In fact, white asbestos is a carcinogen that can cause various cancers including mesothelioma and other diseases.
Moreover, Indonesia is prone to earthquakes and disasters so that buildings and houses that use asbestos can easily become rubble.


Indonesia is very earthquake-prone so buildings and houses that use asbestos can easily become debris. Reuters: Jorge Silva

Indonesia generally treats this asbestos like tobacco: it can cause cancer but is not prohibited.
The difference is that smoking is a personal choice. But thousands of people, including workers in 27 asbestos factories in Indonesia, are unaware of the dangers of this building material.
One of the victims of asbestos named Sriyono, 46 years old, is now a picture of the explosion of asbestos victims.
His dedication worked for 25 years in the factory, instead of bringing prosperity to him, his wife and three children.
Sriyono is now suffering from end-stage lung cancer. He could no longer work because of his illness.
His cancer had undermined his body weight and strength. Weighing now only 37 kilograms, thin, only bones.


Sriyono's condition before and after suffering from cancer due to asbestos. Supplied

"My chest feels very tight. I can't breathe properly. When I try to do something, I get tired easily," he said.
Sriyono was the only Indonesian who received compensation for asbestos-related diseases.
But for him, the compensation of around Rp. 70 million was not entertaining. "I was so angry," he told ABC.
"Until they stop working, the company does not care. They show no mercy, no attention. There is no work safety equipment. It does not meet standards," Sriyono added.
Danger lurks
Not far from Sriyono's residence on the outskirts of Jakarta, it appears how massive the use of asbestos is.
On every street, houses with white asbestos roofs were seen.
In the yard of one of the houses, the piece of asbestos was even lying near the well. There are children playing there.
In another house with a low roof, people were seen drying clothes on the asbestos roof. Here and there asbestos flakes are left scattered on the ground.
This situation is not surprising. Because, Indonesia is the second largest asbestos importer in the world after India.
According to the data, around 115,000 tons of chrysotile are used each year, mostly to produce roofs because they are fire-resistant and strong.


Nationally it is estimated that around 10 percent of homes in Indonesia use a roof made of asbestos that causes cancer. But in Jakarta the figure is around 54 percent. ABC News

So far, the biggest obstacle to banning asbestos in Indonesia is the strong lobbying of this industry. They are actively pushing to expand their markets here.
More than 75 percent of the total use of asbestos in the world is now in Asia.
CIC, based in Bangkok, actually represents asbestos producers in two exporting countries, Russia and Kazakhstan.
In addition to being determined to fight all efforts to ban chrysotile in Indonesia and Asia, CIC is also actively promoting white asbestos as a "safe product".
CIC argues, the manufacturing process is the only potential risk. This risk, he said, can be "controlled" through appropriate technology.
In a video on YouTube, CIC claims that chrysotile is not like brown and blue asbestos. White asbestos, he said, "dissolves" in the lungs within two weeks.
"If it enters the body, it will dissolve by itself within two weeks. It will not harm human health," claims the CIC.
They declared white asbestos as "the safest commercial fiber."


White asbestos is widely mined in several countries including Russia and Kazakhstan. Reuters: Ueslei Marcelino

"The use of controlled chrysotile asbestos and its products are safe for workers and consumers. Those who oppose chrysotile have no convincing arguments to support the ban on this mineral," CIC said.
But medical research has long proven that chrysotile can cause illnesses related to asbestos exposure.
ABC News contacted the CIC to comment, but has not yet received a response.
Explosion of disease
Various international studies show that in every 20 tons of asbestos used, there is one person who will die.
With such benchmarks, it is estimated that nearly 6,000 Indonesians a year now have the potential to develop asbestos-related cancers.
But information and public education on this matter is still very minimal.


Asbestos factory workers in Indonesia are a group of citizens who are most at risk of cancer exposure. ABC News

Now, a number of local NGOs are working with NGOs from other countries actively campaigning about the dangers of asbestos to health.
NGOs from Australia ACTU and APHEDA-Union Aid Abroad, were involved in this activity.
They lobbied the Indonesian government to ban the import and use of asbestos.
"Indonesia has a great potential to experience an explosion in the number of people exposed to asbestos or asbestos-related diseases," said Muhammad Darisman from the Indonesia Ban Asbestos Network.
"Ninety percent of the area is prone to disaster. Asbestos is a dangerous substance when it is destroyed into debris," he explained.
The Government of Indonesia states that it already knows the potential dangers of asbestos but this is an industrial matter in itself that needs to be convinced to stop using it.


The Indonesian government says it is up to the industry whether they want to stop using asbestos or not. ABC News

One of the biggest challenges in Indonesia is the lack of diagnostic tools to determine how many people suffer from asbestos exposure.
At present, asbestosis and thickening of the lining of the lungs can be identified through CT scans.
But most of the cancers caused by asbestos can only be known with concrete evidence of asbestos exposure in the lung tissue. Or it could also be through someone's work history.
"We don't have the equipment to make a diagnosis and the doctors here are not trained to diagnose mesothelioma," explained Doctor Anna Suraya from the Indonesian Occupational Medicine Specialist Association (Perdoki).
So far, only six Indonesians, including Sriyono, have been confirmed to have asbestos-related cancer.
Efforts to ban asbestos
At present 66 countries including Australia have banned the use of all forms of asbestos.
Canada, which was once a major exporter of building materials, also banned last year. Even Vietnam and Laos are now trying to ban asbestos.


Brazil which was once the main exporting country of asbestos has left the industry since 2017. Reuters: Ueslei Marcelino

Trade unions around the world continue to put white asbestos on the list of the UN Rotterdam Convention, which regulates the export-import of hazardous chemicals and pesticides.
This will force Russia and other exporting countries to warn the dangers of asbestos to importing countries like Indonesia if they buy this product.
The Rotterdam Convention scientific panel itself recommends that white asbestos be included in the list because of its carcinogenic nature.
But Russia and its allies, including Kazakhstan, India, Syria and Cuba, have used veto to block the motion since the Rotterdam Convention came into force in 2004.
The CIC lobby group itself argues that white asbestos is safe, because it is not registered in the Rotterdam Convention.
According to Phillip Hazelton of APHEDA-Union Aid Abroad, CIC deliberately manipulated the information.
"The Rotterdam Convention was hijacked as a promotional tool for chrysotile-asbestos," he said. "Making this very dangerous substance appear safe."
Getting worse


Sucking asbestos fibers can cause cancer and disease in various human organs. ABC News: Ario Rasouli

Asbestos is dangerous to humans precisely because it is used in building construction: the fibers do not burn or break.
This fiber can get stuck in the human lung, and spread to other organs.
The WHO policy on asbestos is very strict: "All forms of asbestos, including chrysotile, are carcinogenic to humans, causing mesothelioma and cancer of the lungs, larynx and ovaries."
Recent research from the Global Burden of Disease shows that asbestos causes the death of more than 220,000 people in the world each year.
"Even in countries where the rules are strict, building materials containing chrysotil release asbestos fibers during building maintenance, demolition, and natural disasters," the WHO said.


"I have cancer that will only get worse over time," Sriyono said. ABC News: Phil Hemingway

Meanwhile Sriyono claimed, he did not know how long he could survive due to cancer.
But he knew for certain that this disease would cause his death.
Contrary to the claims of CIC, Sriyono's lungs can no longer dissolve chrysotile fibers in his body.
"The doctor said that I had the same type of cancer"it will get worse over time," Sriyono said.
"Last year I did a health check and the CT scan showed there was an increase in activity in my lungs," he said.
It is estimated that tens of thousands of Indonesians will develop asbestos-related diseases.
But unlike Sriyono, perhaps most of them never knew their illness was caused by asbestos.
